intro: Galeopsis laramberguei, commonly known as Laramie milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, followed by pod-like fruits containing several seeds. Galeopsis laramberguei is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a short-lived perennial.
